result.execSummary:
The defendant Thomas Michael Conley was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Thomas Michael Conley

Status conference on January 12, 2022 at 10:15 am.

It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO ABUSIVE CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Kim C.  The term "abusive contact" is hereby defined as a verbal assault or an intentional infliction of or threat to inflict physical pain, physical injury or illness, an impairment of physical condition, and /or sexual contact or sexual intercourse without consent.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats. THIS CONDITION SHALL ONLY BE EFFECTIVE UPON THE EXPIRATION OF A 72 HOUR NO CONTACT ORDER - expires Friday January 7, 2022 at 8:32 PM).

Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant.

If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bail jumping.

01:34 PM  CO: Vlack, Reporter: Gross, Clerk: Lindabaur. ADA:  Holly Elkin Rockow  DF ATTY: Scott Selmer for today   DF:  Thomas Michael Conley appeared from jail. Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and rights. Defendant understands. Defendant does not qualify for PD- PFAC given. Bond argument; bond ordered. NG.  Reserve on pre-plea rights. DE states he has early onset Alzheimers. Court sets STC to see status of atty. DE enrolled in text message reminders. Adjourned at 1:39 PM.  gll  Status conference scheduled for January 12, 2022 at 10:15 am.
